author: PATRICK C TSAI

review: I got rid of Direct TV, finally, when I thought this gadget might work for me. I am saving $92 a month no longer having satellite and instead pay $7.99 each per month for Hulu+ and Netflix. I bought a Chromecast for each of my televisions as well as inexpensive antennas so that I can pick up local channels! I recommend the Chromecast, just make sure that your television is compatible. If you have a Smart television, you should be all set.
author: Kristi Bancroft "krisms1960"

review: I love technology and being one of the first to try new products, so when I saw the Google Chromecast was coming out, I ordered one right away.  I thought it might be a good way to make my "non smart" TV, "smart".  It did, but for me it was cumbersome and not intuitive.  It was hard to navigate through to places I wanted to go.  I also thought it would be an easy way to "air play" my devices on the tv.  It probably is for Google products, but I have all Apple products.  Not as easy to do.
